text:
sustained rate, over a number of years, is what presumably makes a long-term difference. 
An expected dose-response is seen roughly in the sustained rate ( Figure II-1), measuring the 
resources as CHNWs/1000 households (or children). The results suggest that a level of around 
30 CHNWs/1000 (1 CHNW:33 children, estimated as part time, 0.1 FTEs) is needed for an 
improvement rate of 1 ppt/year or higher in underweight.
The most important implication is that community-based nutrition programmes
